o0q88emYtHxejrOQiuG0dw.text: A happy accident Forest Gumping our way into bbar.  The staff was super welcoming. The food was superb.   Great wine list.   Ask them about the back story on the wild animal photo theme and enjoy your stay.

YDzaMMRxJqPiY5JS_0pReQ.text: Came here for breakfast because it was next door to our hotel. The decor is super cute (it's a south african restaurant). I had a breakfast sandwich (egg, spinich, cheese, tomato) and my friend had the traditional English breakfast. Normally the "traditional English breakfast comes with baked beans, but since this is a south african restaurant, they put a new spin on the beans and they were DELICIOUS!! Kind of in a chunky tomato sauce?? Service was great (but we were the only people there that early in the morning). Heard they have a nice crowd at night.

photos.caption: Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom. Traditional English breakfast (with a South African spin on the beans) YUM!

MhQ_isbp4079eVK9md_jvQ.text: Good, quick option pre or post Buckingham Palace visit. Definitely a tourist spot but they absolutely put out a grand effort! I think I read somewhere... Safari chic. Yes, totally. We kept lucking out, getting the window seat at practically every restaurant we dined at. This was a busy corner just across the way from the Palace, so a fab spot to people watch.It was too early in the day for a drink and we were about to head into the Palace abyss, so we just knocked back a couple a Coca-Colas. Need to say however, the cocktails menu looked amazing. I went way outside my comfort zone and tried the wild boar burger, topped with a quail's egg and spinach  for £13.00 and had a side of thick-cut chips for £13.60. Man had the Cape Malay chicken curry with poppadoms and fragrant rice for £14.50. As you'll see from the pics I added - breathtaking presentation, however, the food quality was just okay. Not horrible, not great. Just okay. I thought the burger was puffed up to hide what should have provided some really interesting palate checkpoints, but it was pretty bland. Man's curry was pretty standard as well. Most UK restaurants have some sort of curry on the menu, regardless of the cuisine, so definitely had better curry elsewhere. Our meals were very pedestrian with all the bells and whistles to attract hungry eyes. Chips were above good though. I would recommend trying b bar for a drink and starter to share after the Palace tour. Trust me, you'll want to chill out a bit after this tour, particularly after the Crown Jewels queue (yipes). Do screaming babies really have an interest in large, oval-cut diamonds and scepters? Methinks not.Very nice service. Shiny, clean environment. I understand they own the attached hotel which I've read is wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom. View from window seat - cross corner view of Buckingham Palace service entrance.
Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom. Cape Malay Chicken Curry
Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom. Wild Boar Burger and side of Thick Cut Chips

XohQM6xCmcGm-6DPD7ao6Q.text: Stumbled in here on Friday early evening while trying to find a good spot to sit and catch up with a friend. Not too busy but also with a good atmosphere, staff were very attentive, excellent service overall.We both had the cheese burger, which we asked for medium rare. It was very tasty and cooked pretty much spot on. Side order of fries was small, but given the size of the burger you don't need much. Decent selection of beers, not massive but enough variety to keep most happy, my friend opted for a cocktail and was happy with it.Think we might come back here again!

lI_Vfu2XjvGOKK71l9_n_w.text: So glad that we stopped in to B Bar. It was right next to our hotel, so we decided to pop in. Everything was wonderful- the burger, the Cobb salad (which is the best I've had) the cheese plate for dessert, etc. Try the honeycomb ice cream -it's amazing!Nice place to stop for a bite and a drink. extremely friendly, attentive staff, fair prices for London. (You are right across from Buckingham Palace.)  Staff was so engaging and genuinely caring and friendly.

1TWvKBKYt2pkBw3X0Un8ag.text: Outstanding food, can't go wrong with any choice. This place is a real foodie gem. Just had the brownie sundae dessert, one of the top 5 desserts I've ever had.

CuHX-qHoXHV_aovpBlGXaQ.text: We had the wagyu and classic burger. I think they might have mixed up our orders as I think I ended up with the wagyu but I'm not really sure. Either way the meat quality was good on both burgers and the fries were tasty.

ma5Ju7wgTAcQgoMpsJOJiw.text: this is a really good option if you're in the victoria area looking for something to eat.other than a bunch of standard chains, there's not much in the vicinity so i'm glad to have somewhere like this on my radar.i came here with work colleagues, as we are based nearby and get discount with our security passes. it's south african themed and there are pictures of safari animals everywhere, which pleases me a lot. animals are my favourite. the menu is mainly burgers, but it does have other options - fish, pasta, snackier things.most of my group ordered variations on the burger, and i settled for the salt beef sandwich. normally i don't eat red meat, but it came on rye bread with pickles and broccoli coleslaw and that sounded too delicious for me to resist!at standard menu prices, £11.50 seems a little steep for what i was given, but the discount made it more reasonable. the food was of excellent quality. my sandwich came with a little three part tray of different mustards - so fun! the salt beef was super good, and piled high on that sandwich, and they were very generous with the amount of pickle on my plate (which is excellent, because pickle is another of my favourite things!)the burgers are pricey and don't come with chips (£2.95 extra), so it IS expensive, but honestly, compared with the rest of the offerings in the area, i'd rather pay a bit more and receive a more enjoyable meal, so i'm okay with that. the atmosphere is great, and the wait staff were really wonderful - friendly, helpful, smiling. will definitely return!

7rCAI1Qi1kHyUVivJon64Q.text: Superb service (Mariza helped us) and excellent food in an interesting setting. I spent about 3 hours there eating and chatting with a colleague. The service was gracious and welcoming and they didn't mind how long we lingered. And of course, the food was splendid.

-cr_j83rY7__-mP6C0vXGw.text: Classic Caesar salad with grilled chicken is best I have had in a long time. Freshly grilled chicken perfectly done and nice and warm on salad. Romaine extremely fresh with bacon pieces. Just enough not overpowering. The dressing drizzled on the chicken and mixed just right on the greens- again not too much and just a hint of anchovies. Shaved parm and small croutons top off the salad. With a nice Chardonnay and very friendly staff , I had a terrific lunch in London.

O9RBKOgtWdlUvTyxtCL6gQ.text: Great place to sit and watch people go by at rush hour. Food was good, good wine list. The prices were very reasonable for London. I had the chicken schnitzel and it was good.

OVBJbhitNxr9tRIOPiTTgw.text: We were very pleased with B Bar. The food was all very good, and the prices were reasonable for London -- I was surprised at this considering its location in a tourist zone so close to Buckingham Palace.

gGTwqOquGeUtFe0utiftgw.text: Cool place with an interesting selection and solid food.  The salt beef sandwich is itself exactly, but if that's what you're in the mood for you won't be disappointed.  The ice cream and cheese deserts were delicious.

19W4ooatcm9BlBU-7hfBow.text: This restaurant has a special dinner for Valentines day which interested me so I treated my wife of thirty-five years to a special meal. We started with a Ostrich carpaccio with truffle oil as a pre-starter and then, for the first course we shared a platter containing Bobotie spring rolls, with Mrs Balls chutney, grilled lamb and apricot sosaties with curry sauce, and Cape Malay chicken and peanut sauce. We could choose any three of five dishes. Then the palate cleaner which was Rooibos (Redbush) jelly topped with Vanilla Pannacotta. Then to the main course which we also shared from a huge platter. We chose grilled Springbok fillet with toasted walnut oil shot, grilled Boerewors saussages with "tomato smoor", oven baked Kingklip (Indian Ocean fish) with citrus beurre blanc and seared lamb cutlets with "red wine jus". We could choose any four from a choice of seven. These were served with seasonal vegitables. Finally for dessert, we chose Amarula crème brulée, warm Cape brandy pudding with toffee sauce and traditionally home made South African koeksisters. Here we could choose any three from a choice of five. We came from an advert in a London weekly called "The South African" and because of that were given two glasses of a South African bubbly from the Simonsig wineries. We chose a bottle of excellent pinotage and with the dessert, we each had a glass of Chenin Blanc dessert wine, yes you can get it as a dessert wine! The whole place produced a quiet atmosphere and it reminded me a little of a Pall Mall club! Subdued lighting and a lot of brown wood about. the standard of décor was very good and the only complaint we had were that the tables were too small for two. However as this sort of menu is only for special events, I guess it is fair that they don't make the tables larger. Their standard menu is functional but nowhere near as exciting as this special event menu was, but a whole lot more inexpensive. Our special meal for two, including wines came to £128 and we came away feeling we had "value for money". Service charge is not added which pleased us both a lot as when I tip, I don't work on percentages but on money, so give a higher percentage on low cost meals and a lower percentage on high cost meals. My thinking is the waiter/ress needs a certain amount per table whatever is spent. In fact, now that it is the morning after, we still felt we had excellent value for money. The food portion came to £37 per person and they had really made an effort to showcase good traditional South African cooking.

9nwjPqHvzt3GXmRzZGBtbQ.text: My wife took me to the restaurant after eating here last year with our daughter. An easy walk from Victoria Station, the decor is African Safari but well done, warm and comfortable. The food was amazing! I had a Ceasar Salad with Chicken that was one of the best I've had. My wife had Duck Confit that was very tender and flavorful. We shared a starter of lamb skewers with apricot; the lamb was a little chewy but very flavorful. The wine selection was huge; something for everyone at any price range. The service was attentive. Reservations are highly recommended as we had to make ours a couple days in advance.

SfeE6kDlepM3YH9bl4rDYw.text: We bought tickets to Wicked which included a meal at Bbar (restaurant side). We were pleasantly surprised. The food was great. From the pre-theatre meal, we had spicy crayfish appetizer, chicken, salmon, mushroom sauce pasta, and dessert. The best part of the meal was the spicy crayfish and salmon. Everything was cooked perfectly. The staff was friendly and attentive. There was another section which was more casual food and bar. We were in the full restaurant side. Décor was African safari which was interesting. Don't let the exterior fool you. The construction is only on the outside of the building. The inside is really peaceful.

0hAf-HMcr14ebtQAIwWw5g.text: Convenient stop before seeing theater. Funky cool decor and excellent service. The fish was done to perfection, the appetizers I can't recall. I'd return with a group. There was a party in the lower level that sounded like a blast.

NONaGqOV3TbpGsEWkIaiNg.text: We have liked this spot so much - we have eaten here twice in 4 days. Four of us Yanks have enjoyed the chicken Caesar salad, salted beef sandwich, chicken curry, and their handmade honeycomb ice cream. Relaxed, classy atmosphere and exceptional service.

A8aqEizdJa2iKEdthrlk3w.text: Nice, not quite sure what the theme is, many South African touches but rather sprinkled in with regular pub food, and no South African wine. Nonetheless great food, the bobotie spring rolls, a twist on South African casserole was further twisted with Vietnamese accompaniments, but still a delicious starter. Attentive and attractive staff. The burger was amazing and sized for my American appetite.  Dining at the bar is a great option for a single diner on a busy night.

photos.caption: Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom. Bobootie Spring Rolls with chili sauce and veggie accompaniments
Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom. Beef Burger with Cheese

g_vVQHKZ6Lh-HQbfmGaJaw.text: Very friendly service but a somewhat mixed experience with the food and drinks. Started with the chopped salad and a Manhattan cocktail. Salad quality was fine although it was served in a ice cream glass which looked pretty but yielded about 1/3 the amount of salad I expected. Manhattan was one of their menu-listed cocktails, it was very watery  and too heavy on the bitters. So far I'm not that impressed.  My main was the African burger which was excellent in presentation, flavors, and meat temperature. I was impressed, the meats (boar and venison) are really easy to overlook, but they got it perfect. I'll come back, but I'll stick with the burger and a pint next time.

DWudjxAW43n4okNgSSittg.text: Worst fish I've ever had and I've had fried fish in a lot of places.  After taking the second bite because I couldn't believe how bad the first one was the stink sat on my plate for 20 minutes while the wait staff stood around talked with each other, instead of checking on the second of two tables in the restaurant.  The waitress did comp me the meal but took 20 minutes to bring the check.

XupUx0y9Cxdiy3OSmncgVg.text: We wanted a late, casual bite near our hotel and read that B Bar had good reviews.  We weren't disappointed!  Fun, casual atmosphere (African safari decor!), friendly service, great beer selection and good food.  The Wagyu and Africa burgers were both tasty.  The super-cool manager was raised in Kenya and said he had hitch-hiked the entire length of Africa.  Will have to come back another time and hear his stories over a few beers!

1F_m2pXHTP7B_NR7TezqMA.text: B Bar was a nice stroll from Buckingham Palace.  Located at the end of the busy street, I was conveniently located after a long tour.  The decorations were of an African Safari.  Wasn't that tacky actually.  We had the Super Salt Beef Sandwich on rye bread, broccoli coleslaw and pickles.  This was definitely their most famous dish.  The beef was moist but the sandwich was plain - no toppings.  EXCELLENT pickles; kind of small but they gave us 4.  The broccoli slaw was weird.  We also bought the African Burger, which consists of wild boar and venison, fried quails egg, cinnamon marog and Chakalaka relish.  Well-cooked.  Side of sweet potato fries made the meal - sold separately.Overall, the place is good because it's close, delicious, and good for people-watching.

umBIfTmNuUe8mlfeiaOIug.text: I'll be honest - when my date suggested a South African restaurant, I was not particularly delighted. I say this as the child of two real life South Africans - I've spent many months in the country and its cuisine is not its strong point. Don't get me wrong, there are plenty of fantastic restaurants (I'll tell Yelp Cape Town about them next time I'm over), and a braai is certain to hit the spot, but stuff like bobotie and bunny chow isn't doing it for me*. As expected, I didn't love the menu. Still, about half of it didn't really seem particularly SA, just generic restaurant stuff like steaks or burgers or fish and chips. And these were rather pricey - something like £19 for the fish and chips! This is in line with the image bbar seems to be trying to portray, of being sophisticated and elegant (so therefore pricey). The toilets give away that this is just an act. Anyway, I ended up with a pork belly burger - which in all fairness was gorgeous, if rather fatty. Quick shout out for the cocktails. I had two different ones and my date had two of the same - his was a standard mojito, while one of mine was a berry mojito and the other was a vodka/honey/lime thing. I can't tell you the exact names because the menu on their website has obviously changed. But I doubt it matters what you have as all three were super delicious, as well as being pretty generous glasses. Sometimes a long cocktail menu is a bad sign, but I'd be happy to come here just for cocktails and try out all the sections (even if the South African section does sound a bit bizarre - e.g. the elephant's reverie, with Amarula Liqueur, Frangelico, Bols Banana Liqueur, Fresh Cream, Chocolate and Kirch cherries).*BIltong is the exception. All hail biltong. It's just hard to have as a whole meal.

FT1HQoXmu--sxqdrz2iT-g.text: I had high hopes for this spot. The decor was fun but too oversized for the space. We had to rotate the table to let our party squeeze in. The menu was unimaginative, but the food was tasty. It was super close to Wicked, which was the remainder of our evening. Our daughters liked their burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom

He_6O7AuEQQjYDsG7HUsYQ.text: My only reason for not giving B Bar 5 stars is that the outdoor and/or window seating is sparse. Other than that, I loved it. Loved the generous pours, the gluten free food recommendations (tough to get without sass these days), and the staff's attentiveness--Although, like most places in Europe, you do need to ask for water and refills. I highly recommend for an afternoon drink, tea, lunch, or book reading :)

BnX0xxMnNNJVjpabehCNPg.text: The comfy armchair style chairs were a nice addition to the already lovely restaurant and were especially great after a long day on our feet shopping! The place has a kind of African theme going on (but not the menu which is varied if not very large) and very relaxing.We had a two course pre-theatre menu and everything was delicious. The restaurant also has an extensive cocktail and wine menu. This was one of the best meals I've had in a long time and I would definitely recommend to anyone in the area.

l3PxMkCaHanzb2ba-OQEKg.text: We were exhausted from walking around this beautiful city and on the way to Victoria Station we noticed "BBar." I am so glad we walked in. First, it is located on a great corner location where you can people watch and there appeared to be a lot of locals coming in for dinner as the rear was packed. We had the drinks at the bar and if you are in the neighborhood I suggest you do the same because if Alex is working the bar you are in for a real treat.Let's face it, the personnel have a lot to do with how an establishment is viewed and Alex "makes this place." He is just a cool, attentive, personable guy and our intended thirty minute stay turned into ninety minutes. We enjoyed every minute. This was basically the last thing that we did in London. When we return, it will be the first.

139kSrW3eDt8XmyBu4kwxA.text: Came here with a group of 14 friends on Wednesday.It is actually part of the Rubens Hotel on Buckingham Palace Road.There is a large bar area at the front, with a more formal raised area at the rear.Started with a draught pint of Budvar at the bar, before being seated at the table.As there were 14 of us, we had to give our choice of main and desert two days before. We started with a large mixed sharing platter consiting of Beef Biltong, Chiken Livers with piri piri sauce, Bobotie Spring Rolls, Chicken and Dill Skewers and bread. Great selection and plenty for us.For the main I went for the African Burger, which consisted of Wild boar and venison, fried quails egg, cinnamon marog and Chakalaka relish, and a side of fries. If I had known it came on a wooden board, I would have probably asked for a plate, but hey that's just a minor detail.For desert, I went for a Khalua based cream softy drink. It was called a Don Pedro which I now understand is a South African originating cocktail.  It was really good, and just right after the two previous heavy courses. For a group of 14, we had a great time. I highly recommend, and would definately go back!On Wednesdays it's s 2 for 1 offer of bottles of Prosecco.

photos.caption: Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom

g4iG8d6xsFGwFddTwcvhjg.text: I wouldn't come here again, the food was barely mediocre, I would have much preferred to cook it myself as it would have been wayyyy tastier. There was also a mixup with my friend's order. Decor wise it does have the African theme and I guess for some that can be appealing but I definitely did not feel the vibe here.

W7Fj0Vbqkg5NGkKhjr6nfw.text: Excellent.  6 people with a variety of food.  Well done.  Service was attentive and manager was very involved.

ISJq4g0L1CHMTfJ-EtTkfg.text: Had some time for lunch before we had to catch the train so we went to this cute little restaurant near Victoria Station. The food was fantastic and the service was wonderful. The staff was very friendly. Had the BBQ short ribs and it came with corn on the cob and sweet potato fries. Everything was fantastic! Loved this place!

FvppSJJ7NQtRitDQsYZvew.text: Where do I start...Ambience!!!! Perfect! The food was delicious. I had the boar burger...stacked mighty high and perfect!

WPcOqR3F3JFPwWliEjp1Lw.text: Decent food selection. I had the Africa burger. It was tasty. Probably a bit over priced. Personally, I would recommend a better draft beer selection but that may not be the clientele they are looking for? If you are staying at the Ruben and need a decent meal, might be an option but would choose the Bag O' Nails across the street for a more authentic feeling atmosphere.

rvOlUBQjfOqmmNtaw36hpw.text: Great place. Friendly staff. Good environment for both kids and adults. Good selection of food and wait staff provides excellent service! Would for sure recommend this to either date or family.

d8U9WQrxmxE8tXzBPAih6A.text: Excellent drinks and food. Went with my mother and 2 teenage daughters and we all loved it.

7NRGaCPQIXS5QmN6SL_AJw.text: This place was an awesome find! Totally by chance as we left Buckingham Palace - but take the table at the window with the comfy chairs and order drinks from Michael, the bartender. Best dirty martini in London and the spiced berry mojitos were to die for!  For dinner, the lamb curry was awesome. So glad we stopped!

RVZG3tKScnNrBpcVWNSogg.text: Yum! Comfy leather chairs, delicious warm pita bread and hummus, and amazing chicken sandwich

VJWUpYnGaaG97Gq9EnWe-g.text: My fiancée and I had our engagement drinks at the downstairs bar, and had a fabulous experience. First, the service was top notch. The staff member was very responsive over email and even those serving drinks on the day were phenomenally kind. In the course of the afternoon, we broke a few glasses by accident, but they were very patient with us and never made a deal out of them. Through and through, I valued the excellent service. Whilst we didn't have any food, the selection of drinks was great as well. They had most everything we ever needed. Ambience was solid as well. Both upstairs and downstairs, the decor was tasteful yet not over the top. I would love to return for food and for future events.

rbaEpUWc5Fe8Bk7UZlkziw.text: Nice decent food here.  The service is above and beyond.  We loved all the staff, from the manager to the two waitresses that made sure we were well taken care of all the time.They have a nice selection of seasonal cocktails as well as ales.  I really enjoyed my Tropic Thunder.  Sweet and tart all at the same time.We started our meal by sharing an order of the bobotie.  Don't what that this is?  Not to worry neither did we.  First you need to know that the restaurant is a fusion of food from Britain to South Africa.  Popular food in South Africa is "Malay".  This is food that is already a fusion of Asian and African.  The bobotie is a fried spring roll stuffed with Malay flavored meats and comes a "British" style chutney for dipping.  Absolutely amazing appetizer.  Forget the calories and order it!  We all decided on burgers for dinner.  I had the Wagyu -  sliced red onion, aged cheddar, avocado and hubby had the African - Wild boar and venison, fried quails egg, nnamon marog and Chakalaka relish.  The burgers were a bit disappointing for me as most burgers served in England are for me.  The meat was over done and a bit over worked leaving it with a bit of a meatloaf texture which I don't care for.  I chose to have my burger with the sweet potato fries which were excellent.On the whole a very satisfying and enjoyable meal!  I would return

photos.caption: Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom. Wagyu burger with sweet potato fries
Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom. African burger.
Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom. Bobotie a really fantastic mix of South Africa, Asia and British. Highly recommend.

ttGXRjxuoiY54mtPnn0d_Q.text: Our last night in London, we are looking for a comfy restaurant near our hotel with great food.  Bingo!   This place was fantastic.  Drinks were well mixed, menu was a bit off the beaten path but with interesting standards.  Food was excellent from starters to main course to dessert.The decor is upscale safari - a bit kitsch and very inviting.  The banquet seating makes you feel like you're in someone's sitting room for drinks.Must try the honeycomb ice cream.  My kids were fighting over the remnants!We'd go again.

photos.caption: Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom. Tasty cocktails!
Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom. Comfy seating!

f8To-9Buk7hBAoHSq31LOQ.text: Great place with great food and even better cocktails. Awesome choice of tunes and the ambience made this a special place for dinner with my love.

xaRe5vZxhn5Ij3muyq2Mow.text: We were having trouble finding any food in London that we really liked. We found this place one afternoon and loved it. Lunch was great. We then came back for dinner a different night and that was fantastic. Service was great. Refills galore and food was yummy. Great vibe and location!

osmqeuo2fWHFAmjqTb6wyQ.text: What a lovely respite we had at this lovely place!   Stopped by late afternoon for some snacks and libation.  The Crimson Crush was delightful and refreshing as we watched the Wimbledon match on TV. We enjoyed chicken satay and veggie samosas with our drinks, and had a terrific chat with the owner/manager who hailed from Kenya.  The food, service, drink and overall vibe of the place was worthy of this review!  Enjoy!

WZsi3JuXFYTvxGpFmWOxFQ.text: Excellent experience. Very warm welcome from the restaurant staff. I strongly suggest ordering the chicken schnitzel with mashed potatoes or fish and chips with mushy peas. Complete your dinner by ordering a traditional spot of tea on fine China. The owner is from South Africa and the Decour and is symbolic of South Africa.

xiBNgIFkxJTXjdKPzjBhdg.text: My husband and I planned a Greek island hopping trip and wanted to plan an extended layover somewhere else in Europe. After searching for flights, we settled on a 16-hour layover in London. We decided not to do any research and to just play it by ear.After arriving at Heathrow, a couple of people directed us to do some touristy things. After seeing the Buckingham Palace, we walked around looking for a decent restaurant. B Bar caught our eye because it seemed to have some nice menu options and it looked very nice inside. First, I'm amazed that it seems like everywhere in Europe offers complimentary wifi, including restaurants and public transportation. The U.S. could really learn a thing or two. Anyway, back to the restaurant. My husband orders the African burger which is venison and wild boar. I took a bite and it was so delicious! I got a regular burger, but I wish I had ordered the African burger because it was so flavorful and tender. Outside of our food and drinks being good, the service was awesome. We obviously had American accents (and mannerisms lol) and we were checked on by the server, bartender, and manager. It wasn't particularly busy, but I still appreciated the attentive service. I wish I lived in London so I could go more often!

6ctVjhcUFQgJwAAqaGzMfA.text: Typical London prices, excellent service, excellent food.  Unfortunately typical London drinks equals minimal alcohol.  Stick with the beer or wine and you'll be happy.

oAr1YpsJhnqsIpX-GNw_cA.text: This is an eclectic bar playing Detroit MoTown music, African themed decor, and above average bar food like burgers, salads, and shepherds pie. Service was attentive. My only complaint was they added  on both a 20% VAT charge and a 12.5% service charge. Every other restaurant in London includes the VAT in the price. Thus the final price was way too expensive for the quality offered

5-R8rNz3I904WEmG8yOxbA.text: What a great bar/restaurant in a great location. Very friendly staff, attentive and knowledgeable.  Alex pours a great drink! The menu is unique and the food is delicious.  We enjoyed it so much we went three times in five days while staying next door! Can't wait to go back!

L7qNaIpoqclgAc6NC9iUyQ.text: I love this restaurant because I am always staying at The Rubens and it is conveniently located downstairs! It's South African themed, which is also a nice break from the traditional British cuisine. The food is fresh, healthy if you want it to be, but also has several indulgences listed. It's a more laid back yet somehow still posh environment, which makes it a good place to spend a couple hours with a bottle of wine!

SaAnr_WAj1wvcoSYygXg8A.text: This is probably the best restaurant near Buckingham palace. Meatballs that come with Mac and cheese balls are delicious, and the duck cottage pie is one of a kind.

g7jfLJejzmkJbUfIes5PLQ.text: Great location across from Buckingham Palace. The fish and chips, burgers and drinks were all great. Please make a point to stop by when you are there!

gz-Mx5RtzbOxmfTtBKBz_A.text: Two years later and this place does not disappoint. Exceptional staff, food, and drinks with an upbeat urban environment.  The drink I had two years ago was no longer on the menu, but they made it anyway...exactly the way it was. Familiar staff faces reflect pride in the job and quality leadership. Future visits...I'll be here!

xNZvffAZ78YFj3MsH3pC-Q.text: My wife and I were on our honeymoon in Europe and had a great dinner here!  We loved the decor, there is an African/safari theme to it, which sounds cheesy, but it was actually really chic and well done.Food and drinks were quite delicious, and the service was stellar.  We had the Wagyu beef burgers, and I had a vodka martini.  The only snafu was for our appetizer, we ordered what we thought was an Artisinal breads and olives plate for 5 pounds, but it was just the breads.  The olives were a separate item and an additional 5 pounds (the two were printed on the same line of the menu, it was a bit confusing).  Other than that, I would have given them 5 stars.

96CF0QEbDVYCkJXT50GxUA.text: B Bar was the best restaurant we had tried in London so far.We ordered their steak, steamed mussels, grilled fish fillet and red wines; we weren't going to eat dinner here at first, but after trying their great red wine and perfectly cooked mussels (decent sizes), we could not resist to order more. The fish fillet was very fresh and tasty, with a touch of lemon juice to bring out the flavor; the steak was super juicy and flavorful, with red, it was heavenly! The manager was kind enough to give us an order of spinach on the house since we didn't order any veggies, it was so creamy and delicious! Of course, finishing up with their ice cream desserts! Customer service was fantastic! They were all very friendly and attentive, just one eye contact, someone came right to us to make sure we needed. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom

Td99nDfZJ8eidu7Ouc1ZtA.text: This was our late breakfast place. My husband had some elements of an English breakfast: eggs, mushrooms, bacon, and sausage. I had spinach, grilled sheep halloumi (cheese) and tomato hummus with two hashbrows. I loved that my sandwich was served on a wooden cutting board. The flavors were great. This restaurant was recommended to us by a staff person from the Rubens hotel - and it was a winner.

photos.caption: Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom. Bacon, eggs, sausage, mushroom
Photo of B Bar - London, United Kingdom. I didn't know it before but the halloumi is cheese

MxPq0_C0IaSnjfvOVLCS9A.text: Alex and Tony are amazing. Please sit at the bar, purely to enjoy their company. Every cocktail was made with precision and grace ,and the freshest ingredients. Simply put, amazing. If I could give 10 stars, I would.  Such a fantastic place.
